result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Thomas Waligora

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant John Thomas Waligora in court.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for John Thomas Waligora. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF1124/22FO604. Attorney Mastantuono advises the Court that the parties are discussing resolving the matter with a DPA and would be requesting an adjournment to further discuss and draft the agreement. The State agrees. Court adjourns. FO case continue to trail.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant, John Thomas Waligora, appeared with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Amended complaint received; reading waived.   ST called witness ; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty . ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 471930,

Amount: $20.00

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: RMS JES WEC.

01:48 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 9/1/22 @945am. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). ec
